definition: to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
(negative prefix)/not/no
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
variant of 餘|余[yu2], remainder
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li

sentences.english: All it will take is a will to be ambitious and a determination to leave no stone unturned.
sentences.chinese: 這需要野心和不遺餘力的決心。

sentences.english: Many educationists think highly of the aesthetic education and try their best to advocate it.
sentences.chinese: 許多教育家都重視美育，不遺餘力地提倡美育。
儘管他們不遺餘力救災，但還是有11萬人殞命。

sentences.english: Developed nations should spare no effort to finance their economically disadvantaged counterparts.
sentences.chinese: 發達國家應該不遺餘力地資助貧國。

sentences.english: She was unstinting in her efforts to help.
sentences.chinese: 她不遺餘力地提供援助。

sentences.english: The city’s leading politicians have wasted little time in condemning this latest killing.
sentences.chinese: 該市主要的政治家不遺餘力地譴責這起最新的謀殺。

sentences.english: They would do anything to accomplish their goals.
sentences.chinese: 他們會不遺餘力地實現目標。

sentences.english: Provides the flawless sense of hearing for the net friend to enjoy sparely no effort.
sentences.chinese: 爲網友提供至善至美的聽覺享受不遺餘力。

sentences.english: In order to raise more funds before, Biden also spared no effort.
sentences.chinese: 爲了在此之前籌集到更多資金，拜登也不遺餘力。

sentences.english: YOS, in particular, should spare no efforts to push forward.
sentences.chinese: 黃老鞋尤其應該不遺餘力勇往直前。

sentences.english: We should make all our efforts to improve our environment.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該不遺餘力地美化我們的環境。

sentences.english: We spare no efforts in endeavoring to be of service to you.
sentences.chinese: 我方將不遺餘力爲貴方效勞。

sentences.english: I hate the man who has no personality.
sentences.chinese: 有樣學樣，我不喜歡，完全否定，不遺餘力。

sentences.english: So the following selection is much like the Eye – unsparing.
sentences.chinese: 因此，以下圖片均是不遺餘力的精選之作。

sentences.english: He went to all lengths in opposing the monarchial form of government.
sentences.chinese: 在反抗帝王專制政體鬥爭中，他不遺餘力。

sentences.english: YOS（Yellow Old Shoes)，in particular, should spare no efforts to push forward.
sentences.chinese: 黃老鞋尤其應該不遺餘力勇往直前。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
zeal/enthusiasm/ardor/enthusiastic/warmhearted
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
to hope/to expect/expectation(s)
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
active/energetic/vigorous/positive (outlook)/proactive
to develop/to make full use of
disadvantaged social groups (e.g. the handicapped)/the economically and politically marginalized/the dispossessed
to advocate/to initiate/to propose/to be a proponent of (an idea or school of thought)
to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to provide assistance/to aid
charity event/public service activities
devotion/fervor
creative industries (design, music, publishing etc)/abbr. for 文化創意產業|文化创意产业
